DataElement.preferredName: Esophageal Tumor Across Gastroesophageal Junction Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not the tumor is located across the gastroesophageal junction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Esophageal Carcinoma Across Gastroesophageal Junction Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa. Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma. This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.:Being above or beyond something._The anatomical location where the esophagus joins to the stomach._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa.  Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma.  This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.  --2002

Concepts.definition: A malignant epithelial tumor arising from the esophageal mucosa. Two major histologic types of esophageal carcinoma have been described: squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma. This type of cancer is associated with excessive ethanol and cigarette usage.

Concepts.definition: The anatomical location where the esophagus joins to the stomach.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
